authors.name: Rebecca A. Clemons
authors.affiliation: University of Texas at Austin; University of Michigan

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"489tc","text":"This protocol is used for quantifying the amount of the DNA mycovirus BdDV-1 in DNA extracts or cDNA libraries.  This virus is associated with the fungus Batrachochytrium dendrobatidis (Bd), and it is known to be endogenized in the genome of a large number of Bd strains. The assay uses real time quantitative PCR with Taqman probes. Setup of the reaction is typically done in a biosafety cabinet. This protocol has been optimized on a QuantStudio 3 (Applied Biosystems).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfk7k","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Chytrid Fungi - Molecular and Genomic Techniques

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3mgt8","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qnbf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ak4q","text":"BdV F: CCTGAGTACCCTGATCACAATGT","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acph7","text":"BdV R: GGGTCATTGGTCGTATCTTCA","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b20ci","text":"BdV Probe: MBGNFQ-CCATGGTGGCGTTCT-NED","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qlak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el51v","text":"Standards for viral copy number were created by cloning PCR products from BdV F and BdV R primers into pCR 2.1-TOPO vector using the TOPO TA cloning kit. Plasmids from transformed E. coli colonies with successful insert were extracted using the Zyppy Plasmid Miniprep kit. DNA of plasmid extracts was quantified with a Qubit. Plasmid copy numbers were estimated using the formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rljb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m6mv","text":"Number of copies per uL = [(g/uL) / plasmid length in bp * 650)] * (6.022 * 1023)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":78,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s0lv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a78hc","text":"Extracts were then diluted to a final concentration of 106 viral copies per total 35uL volume for qPCR standards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":57,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eidn1","text":"Wipe down pipettes with 70% ethanol and place in the biosafety hood with tips and 96 well plate. UV for at least   (longer is fine).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6eerh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"C826D000D85511EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er36s","text":"After setting up hood to UV, prepare standard dilutions on the bench using barrier tips. Fill 6 1.5uL microcentrifuge tubes with   of PCR water. Label the tubes 105-100. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":163,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":167,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":129,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3auvp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"90","error":false,"guid":"D33F1560D85511EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1eov","text":"Prepare the master mix in the biosafety hood. All reagents can be thawed quickly on the bench, flicked to mix, and briefly spun down on a tabletop centrifuge before preparation. All the reagents and master mix should be kept   during the preparation. Volumes per well: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":225,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"38gcr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7osk","text":"      Radiant Probe Lo-ROX   qPCR Kit  12.5uL    PCR water  2.75uL    BdV F primer (18uM)  1.25uL    BdV R primer (18uM)  1.25uL    BdV probe (5uM) –protect from light when   not in use  1.25uL    BSA (400ng/uL)  1uL  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":218}],"data":{}},{"key":"6fr98","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k5rd","text":"Multiply above values by the total number of wells on the plate that will be used plus an additional 2 wells for pipette error. Standards and negative control should be run in triplicate, samples should be run in duplicate. If total master mix volume exceeds  , divide total volume in 2 and prepare master mix in 2 identical 1.5mL tubes. Add the appropriate amount of each reagent to each 1.5mL tube, working   with barrier tips. Once all the reagents have been added, flick the tubes to mix and briefly spin down. Return the tubes to the ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":259,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":409,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"799su","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2AC034E0D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":""},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["378","84"],"data":[["Radiant Probe Lo-ROX qPCR Kit","12.5 uL"],["PCR water","2.75 uL"],["BdV F primer (18 uM)","1.25 uL"],["BdV R primer (18 uM)","1.25 uL"],["BdV probe (5 uM) –protect from light when not in use","1.25 uL"],["BSA (400 ng/uL)","1 uL"]],"guid":"2E87D405D85411EDBD640A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Radiant Probe Lo-ROX qPCR Kit","12.5 uL"],["PCR water","2.75 uL"],["BdV F primer (18 uM)","1.25 uL"],["BdV R primer (18 uM)","1.25 uL"],["BdV probe (5 uM) –protect from light when not in use","1.25 uL"],["BSA (400 ng/uL)","1 uL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"49A1A1F0D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3B2F8330D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2j64i","text":"Add master mix to the 96 well plate. Put the plate on a 96 well rack and place it  . Add   of master mix to each well on the plate that will be used. A single barrier tip can be used for all the wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5717FB90D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"5A6307E0D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jj6q","text":"Once all samples have been added to the plate, seal the plate with optical adhesive sealing film. Make sure that the edges and corners are well sealed. Using the corner of a plastic sealing tool to press down the edges and corners is helpful.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3u8c2","text":"Spin down the entire plate in a centrifuge briefly to make sure the liquid is at the bottom of the wells. Try to remove any bubbles be gently tapping the plate against the bench and spinning again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84hqp","text":"Set up the qPCR machine for the run. Make sure that the plate is   while you are doing this step (it can also be done ahead of time).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7E6E0540D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek68c","text":"Open up the QuantStudio software. Name the experiment. Set Run Mode to “Fast”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aq8mg","text":"Make sure total well volume is set to  . Run conditions are:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bm845","text":"  for   (set ramp up to 3.96)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7cc5e","text":"50 cycles of:  for   (set ramp up to 3.96) then   for   (ramp down to 3.02).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":19,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"93A5D820D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"96288B60D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":20,"guid":"995CB450D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AC1CF780D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1,"guid":"9E4AE950D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"5":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B21374C0D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"60","unit":10}},"6":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":20,"guid":"B60FA8A0D85611EDB13A2DD39E42EE86","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nsvo","text":"Input the names for your wells into the software. This can be done manually or by copying and pasting the sample names in a list format from excel, where wells are labeled 1-96 and sample names are listed in order of A1-A12, then B1-12, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fc0be","text":"Mark all of the standard wells as standards in the software. Input the correct quantities for each of the standards (e.g., the quantity for the 106 sample should be input as 1000000).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":146,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk6ha","text":"Label the negative control wells as negatives and the rest of the occupied wells as sample wells (or unknowns).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6htbd","text":"Place the 96 well plate into the machine (making sure it is in the correct orientation) and start the run!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a29kg","text":"At the end of the run, check the standards to make sure that the replicates reasonably overlap with one another and that there is no amplification in the negative controls. It is not unusual to have outliers or no amplification in some of the lower dilutions. Check the standard curve. Efficiency should be between 90-110%, R2 should be as close to 1 as possible, and error should be as close to 0 as possible. If necessary, outlier standard replicates can be removed in the software to change these values and the samples can be reanalyzed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8omt","text":"Export your data as an .xls file. This will contain the quantities for each sample, including the mean and SD of the replicates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qjc2","text":"Add   of the 106 virus standard to the 105 tube, pipetting up and down several times to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":41,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"1B4ADCA7D85611EDBD640A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah1v7","text":"Repeat this, adding   from the 105 tube to the 104 tube and so on. You should have 7 standards total, 106-100.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":33,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":49,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":104,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"22AE6FFED85611EDBD640A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
